summary.p: 36 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 130; Qurʾānic Text: Q 5:45-6:2, Q 19:1-25:64; 17 lines per page; Dimensions: 284 x 349mm; Script style: kūfī A.I.
The fragment Arabe 334 (a) (BNF) belongs to the same manuscript.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
"Marcel 130
36 fol., 349×284 mm (1.23). Support: parchment of different thickness, transparent, smooth, darkish of various shades. Writing material: black and brown ink.
Collation: four quires; after the conservation all the sheets are bifolia (except fol. 17 and 26) the character of their damage does not allow to determine their original nature.
I: F1H F2H F3H / H4F H5F H6F;
II: F7H F8H F9H F10H F11H / H12F H13F H14F H15F H16F;
III: F17H F18H F19H F20H F21H / H22F H23F H24F H25F H26F;
IV: F27H F28H F29H F30H F31H / H32F H33F H34F H35F H36F
Text layout: 260×215 mm (1.2) and 260×210 mm (1.24), 17 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: A I. Diacritics: diagonal dashes in the same ink as the main text. Vocalization: round red and brown dots.

Verse markers: for individual verses – three or four diagonal dashes in the same ink as the main text; for groups of dive verses – letter alif; for groups of ten verses – round cirvles in the text line (type 1.А.5?) flanked with groups of two or more diagonal dots.
Blank lines left for surah headings.

Inscriptions: numbers of surahs in Roman numerals are inscribed in pencil on every page of the first quire; numbers of surahs in Roman numerals are also inscribed on fol. 7r, 10r, 35r; in the upper left corner of fol. 36v number “№2” is inscribed in.
Traces of old conservation: text in some places has been overwritten in black ink.

In 2006 the manuscript has undergone conservation at the Federal center of paper conservation: the sheets have been straightened out, fortified with paper at the folds (except fol. 17 and 26), in the places of tears and along the edges.
Defects: traces of moisture and deterioration of parchment at the corners; ink peeling off on the flesh side and even on the hair side; text loss at the places of the damage of parchment.

Attached materials: before conservation the manuscript was protected with a wrapper of thick cardboard; its fragment with inscriptions has been preserved (fol. I). It contains inscribed old accession number “D”, number of sheets, in ink, in Marcel’s hand – “66 feuillets”, number of lines “17 lig.”; old accession numbers “Q” и “№ 2” inscribed in pencil.
Old accession numbers: Q (on the wrapper), № 2 (according to 2nd Langlois’ inventory).
Contents:
Fol. 1r–6v. Surah 5, verses 49(45) – 120(120)*. Incipit: [أنزَلَ اللّهُ فَأُوْ]لَـئِكَ هُمُ الظَّالِمُونَ.
Fol. 6v. Surah 6, verses 1(1) – 2(2). Explicit: ثُمَّ أَنتُمْ [تَمْتَرُونَ] .
Fol. 7r–10r. Surah 19, verses 1(1)-98(98)*. Incipit: [فَجَعَلْنَاهُمُ] الْأَخْسَرِينَ.
Fol. 10r–15r. Surah 20.
Fol. 15r–19v. Surah 21.
Fol. 19v–24v. Surah 22.
Fol. 24v–28r. Surah 23.
Fol. 28r – 33v. Surah 24,
Fol. 33v – 36r. Surah 25, verses 1(1) – 65(64). Explicit: ???
Other fragments of the same manuscript: Arabe 334a (BNF)."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
